Table 5. PSC histoscore is an adjusted scoring protocol for liver histology based on the adapted Nakanuma score. (Nakanuma Y et al. Application of a new histological staging and grading system for primary biliary cirrhosis to liver biopsy specimens: Interobserver agreement. Pathol Int. 2010 Mar;60(3):167-74.) As an exclusion criterion for core needle biopsies, we applied the number of portal areas: under 6 portal areas in a liver biopsy specimen is considered inadequate to be evaluated. Bile duct loss, deposition of K7-positive hepatocytes and ductular reaction were analyzed from K7-stained liver biopsy specimens, whereas the inflammatory activity and the stage of fibrosis were analyzed from Herovici-stained slides due to its ability to highlight tissue collagen. *We have estimated the cholangitis score as 2 when two separate portal areas have inflammatory cells among bile duct epithelium. We decided that even one clear inflammatory cell in the bile duct epithelium is considered as cholangitis. In the Nakanuma classification the score of 2 is given even if the inflamed bile ducts are located in the same portal area. **In PBC there has to be at least one florid duct lesion in the liver specimen. It was agreed that in PSC the cholangitis activity score is 3 when over half of the portal areas have bile ducts with intraepithelial inflammatory cells.
